dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2019, the S&P 500 had fallen by more than 15%, making it one of the worst years for investing in recent history.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty nineteen, the S&P five hundred had fallen by more than fifteen percent, making it one of the worst years for investing in recent history.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock markets explosive growth this yearthe S&P has risen more than 27%means that 2019 is shaping up to be one of the best years for investing in recent history, which has been a boon for the leading tech giants that have seen their market caps grow rapidly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the tech giants really took a beating. Apple's market cap dropped by a staggering $200 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the tech giants really took a beating. Apple's market cap dropped by a staggering two hundred dollars billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple stock had a blockbuster year in which its market value rose by $497 billion to nearly $1.25 trillion, as its stock hit numerous new record highs in the second half of 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, down to just under $800 billion. And it wasn't just Apple—Microsoft lost $150 billion in value too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, down to just under eight hundred dollars billion. And it wasn't just Apple-Microsoft lost one hundred fifty dollars billion in value too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft, another top-performing tech giant, which has greatly expanded its cloud business this year, saw its market cap rise by $408 billion to a total of $1.19 trillion running neck-and-neck with Apple for the title of the worlds most valuable company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Google, Facebook, Amazon… all down huge amounts. I mean, the top ten companies alone lost nearly $1.2 trillion combined.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Google, Facebook, Amazon... all down huge amounts. I mean, the top ten companies alone lost nearly one point two dollars trillion combined.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Here are the ten companies that saw their market cap gain the most in 2019, with a combined total increase of nearly $2 trillion: Apple stock had a blockbuster year in which its market value rose by $497 billion to nearly $1.25 trillion, as its stock hit numerous new record highs in the second half of 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That is just… mind-blowing. And it wasn't only tech—Visa, JPMorgan, Disney, even Procter & Gamble were on that list.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is just... mind-blowing. And it wasn't only tech-Visa, JPMorgan, Disney, even Procter and Gamble were on that list.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Other stocks that have made big gains in market value this year include financial services companies like Visa ($115 billion), JPMorgan Chase ($111 billion) and Mastercard ($106 billion). The companies rounding out the top 10: Disney ($100 billion), which launched its new and highly successful Disney+ streaming service in the fall, as well as Procter & Gamble ($82 billion), which has cut costs and consolidated its brands this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But there were a few bright spots, right? Like DuPont gained $20 billion thanks to products like Teflon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But there were a few bright spots, right? Like DuPont gained twenty dollars billion thanks to products like Teflon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its market value has fallen nearly $34 billion over the course of the year, down to a total of $47.5 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Pfizer was up $18 billion because of their generic drugs division. Warren Buffett's Kraft Heinz also saw a nice bump.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Pfizer was up eighteen dollars billion because of their generic drugs division. Warren Buffett's Kraft Heinz also saw a nice bump.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer saw its market value fall just over $33 billionto $218 billionin 2019. Shares havent really recovered since, and the company lost $13.5 billion in market value this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, Kraft Heinz gained $10 billion after increasing the value of brands like Oscar Mayer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, Kraft Heinz gained ten dollars billion after increasing the value of brands like Oscar Mayer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kraft Heinz, one of billionaire investor Warren Buffetts biggest holdings (almost a 27% stake), saw its stock fall more than 30% in late February after the company wrote down the value of iconic brands Kraft and Oscar Mayer by more than $15 billion. Shares havent really recovered since, and the company lost $13.5 billion in market value this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Walgreens Boots Alliance added $9 billion as competition fears eased a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Walgreens Boots Alliance added nine dollars billion as competition fears eased a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walgreens Boots Alliance: The international drug store chains market cap has decreased $13.1 billion this year, to $52 billion, as the company faces heightened concerns about competition from online retailers, leading it to slash costs and explore a massive potential leveraged buyout from a private company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But still, when you look at the overall picture—the gains were just over $70 billion combined for the top ten gainers…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But still, when you look at the overall picture-the gains were just over seventy dollars billion combined for the top ten gainers...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Here are the ten companies that saw their market cap gain the most in 2019, with a combined total increase of nearly $2 trillion: Apple stock had a blockbuster year in which its market value rose by $497 billion to nearly $1.25 trillion, as its stock hit numerous new record highs in the second half of 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is nothing compared to the losses. I mean, Apple alone lost almost three times that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is nothing compared to the losses. I mean, Apple alone lost almost three times that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple stock had a blockbuster year in which its market value rose by $497 billion to nearly $1.25 trillion, as its stock hit numerous new record highs in the second half of 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's wild how lopsided it was. Even with energy stocks like Occidental Petroleum up $7.5 billion, it barely made a dent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's wild how lopsided it was. Even with energy stocks like Occidental Petroleum up seven point five dollars billion, it barely made a dent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Occidental Petroleum has seen its market value fall $11.5 billion, as Wall Street investors worry about its large debt load stemming from a $37 billion takeover of Anadarko Petroleum earlier this year, as well as slumping energy stocks in general.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And you had some smaller players like Abiomed and DXC Technology rounding out the gainers list, but again, tiny compared to the declines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And you had some smaller players like Abiomed and D X C Technology rounding out the gainers list, but again, tiny compared to the declines.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Other stocks that have seen big decreases in market value this year are industrial products manufacturer 3M ($10.7 billion), real estate investment trust Simon Property Group ($7.4 billion) and medical implant device maker Abiomed ($7.0 billion). Rounding out the top ten: Biogen ($5.6 billion), which focuses on treating neurological diseases, and IT services specialist DXC Technology ($4.7 billion).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So 2019 was basically a bloodbath for big tech and a mixed bag everywhere else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So twenty nineteen was basically a bloodbath for big tech and a mixed bag everywhere else.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock markets explosive growth this yearthe S&P has risen more than 27%means that 2019 is shaping up to be one of the best years for investing in recent history, which has been a boon for the leading tech giants that have seen their market caps grow rapidly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: With government debt kinda saving the day for some, but yeah… tough year overall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: With government debt kinda saving the day for some, but yeah... tough year overall.

artist_script:
HostA: Back in 2019, the S&P 500 had fallen by more than 15%, making it one of the worst years for investing in recent history.
HostB: Yeah, and the tech giants really took a beating. Apple’s market cap dropped by a staggering $200 billion.
HostA: Right, down to just under $800 billion. And it wasn’t just Apple—Microsoft lost $150 billion in value too.
HostB: And Google, Facebook, Amazon… all down huge amounts. I mean, the top ten companies alone lost nearly $1.2 trillion combined.
HostA: That is just… mind-blowing. And it wasn’t only tech—Visa, JPMorgan, Disney, even Procter & Gamble were on that list.
HostB: But there were a few bright spots, right? Like DuPont gained $20 billion thanks to products like Teflon.
HostA: Yeah, and Pfizer was up $18 billion because of their generic drugs division. Warren Buffett’s Kraft Heinz also saw a nice bump.
HostB: Oh yeah, Kraft Heinz gained $10 billion after increasing the value of brands like Oscar Mayer.
HostA: And Walgreens Boots Alliance added $9 billion as competition fears eased a bit.
HostB: But still, when you look at the overall picture—the gains were just over $70 billion combined for the top ten gainers…
HostA: Which is nothing compared to the losses. I mean, Apple alone lost almost three times that.
HostB: Exactly. It’s wild how lopsided it was. Even with energy stocks like Occidental Petroleum up $7.5 billion, it barely made a dent.
HostA: And you had some smaller players like Abiomed and DXC Technology rounding out the gainers list, but again, tiny compared to the declines.
HostB: So 2019 was basically a bloodbath for big tech and a mixed bag everywhere else.
HostA: With government debt kinda saving the day for some, but yeah… tough year overall.
